Author: K0B3ryant
Text: Thank you so much for sharing your perspective. That really really helped me.

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: I think when you’re struggling or overwhelmed and don’t know how to articulate the experience or identify the issue...that’s when getting outside help is super valuable. A good therapist can ask questions and help you better understand what’s going on and how to acquire skills to start reducing the distress/suffering. They have the training and neutral perspective to see the big picture that we often struggle to perceive on our own.   Though thinking about it, I guess I don’t view disclosing stuff to my therapist as ‘letting them in’...maybe because it’s a clinical relationship? I do find it essential to trust that they’ll keep my info confidential and that they’re not going to mete out judgmental bs.
